block.p: ELECTRONIC ARTS CORP., Redwood City, Calif., which makes software for interactive games, said it planned to split its stock two shares for one. The split will double the number of shares to 142 million while halving the value of each share. The new shares will be issued on Sept. 8 to shareholders of record as of Aug. 25. The shares traded at $91.875, apiece, up $2.3175.

CITIGROUP INC., New York, the financial services giant, said it agreed to purchase privately held AST StockPlan Inc., a stock benefit plan services provider that specializes in technology companies. Terms of the deal were not disclosed. The deal is expected to close by the end of the month.

MOTOROLA INC., Horsham, Pa., the cellular phone company's broadband communications division said that it won a contract to supply digital set-top boxes to AT&T Corp.'s broadband division, based in Englewood, Colo., through 2003. AT&T Broadband also plans to buy 700,000 Motorola cable modems through the end of next year. Financial terms of the deal were not disclosed.

FOSTER WHEELER CORP., Clinton, N.J., a construction and engineering company, said its Spanish subsidiary, in conjunction with two other Spanish companies, was awarded a contract valued at $480 million by GE Plastics, based in Pittsfield, Mass., to construct a plant in Spain. Foster Wheeler said its Foster Wheeler Iberia subsidiary will help build the plant in Cartagena, on Spain's Mediterranean coast.
